messages.message:
this seems like a weird bug on instabase.com (http://instabase.com) - or i’m doing something wrong.

I have this folder that contains a Refiner 5 project created with the wizard: https://instabase.com/felicia/my-repo/fs/Instabase%20Drive/ABBYY%20vs%20Find%20Lines/abbyy/

I didn’t upload any files to input, I created the input folder later on and added 4 files to it. I then added another 3 files to it. I ran the `post_install_script.flow` with the settings I wanted, and it shows as processing X out of 7 files. When I open the Refiner program or look at the `out` folder, it only contains ibocr/records referring to the first 4 files?

If you look at the batch.ibflowresults (https://instabase.com/apps/flow/results/felicia/my-repo/fs/Instabase%20Drive/ABBYY%20vs%20Find%20Lines/abbyy/ABBYY%20lines/out/batch.ibflowresults) file, it shows that the 3 new inputs are status=NOT_OK because of the following error message from process_files:
```tile cannot extend outside image. Image: felicia/my-repo/fs/Instabase Drive/ABBYY vs Find Lines/abbyy/ABBYY lines/out/s1_process_files/images/table_2.pdf_p0.jpg```
The input PDFs are formatted very strange rotation-wise. Looks like some of the content extends off-page, which I'm not sure we support.
Oh also I re-ran post_install_script while debugging -- hope that's ok!
yeah those 3 extra input files are just one specific file rotated 90, 180, 270 degrees
